channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- NEX-Forms
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- NEX-Forms

item.title: CVE-2023-0439|2023-07-17T13:29:58.934Z -- unknown -- nex-forms
item.description: The NEX-Forms WordPress plugin before 8.4.4 does not escape its form name, which could lead to Stored Cross-Site Scripting issues. By default only SuperAdmins (in multisite) / admins (in single site) can create forms, however there is a settings allowing them to give lower roles access to such feature.

item.title: CVE-2023-0272|2023-03-27T15:37:41.482Z -- unknown -- nex-forms
item.description: The NEX-Forms WordPress plugin before 8.3.3 does not validate and escape some of its shortcode attributes before outputting them back in a page/post where the shortcode is embed, which could allow users with the contributor role and above to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks

item.title: CVE-2023-2114|2023-05-08T13:58:08.740Z -- unknown -- nex-forms
item.description: The NEX-Forms WordPress plugin before 8.4 does not properly escape the `table` parameter, which is populated with user input, before concatenating it to an SQL query.
